1.text: Call now if there be any that will answer thee, and turn to some of the saints.

2.text: Anger indeed killeth the foolish, and envy slayeth the little one.

3.text: I have seen a fool with a strong root, and I cursed his beauty immediately.

4.text: His children shall be far from safety, and shall be destroyed in the gate, and there shall be none to deliver them.

5.text: Whose harvest the hungry shall eat, and the armed man shall take him by violence, and the thirsty shall drink up his riches.

6.text: Nothing upon earth is done without a voice cause, and sorrow doth not spring out of the ground.

7.text: Man is born to labour and the bird to fly.

8.text: Wherefore I will pray to the Lord, and address my speech to God:

9.text: Who doth great things and unsearchable and wonderful things without number:

10.text: Who giveth rain upon the face of the earth, and watereth all things with waters:

11.text: Who setteth up the humble on high, and comforteth with health those that mourn.

12.text: Who bringeth to nought the designs of the malignant, so that their hands cannot accomplish what they had begun:

13.text: Who catcheth the wise in their craftiness, and disappointeth the counsel of the wicked:

14.text: They shall meet with darkness in the day, and grope at noonday as in the night.

15.text: But he shall save the needy from the sword of their mouth, and the poor from the hand of the violent.

16.text: And to the needy there shall he hope, but iniquity shall draw in her mouth.

17.text: Blessed is the man whom God correcteth: refuse not therefore the chastising of the lord:

18.text: For he woundeth, and cureth: he striketh, and his hands shall heal.

19.text: In six troubles he shall deliver thee, and in the seventh, evil shall not touch thee.

20.text: In famine he shall deliver thee from death: and in battle, from the hand of the sword.

21.text: Thou shalt he hidden from the scourge of the tongue: and thou shalt not fear calamity when it cometh.

22.text: In destruction and famine then shalt laugh: and thou shalt not be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

23.text: But thou shalt have a covenant with the stones of the lands, and the beasts of the earth shall be at pence with thee.

24.text: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle is in peace, and visiting thy beauty thou shalt not sin.

25.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be multiplied, and thy offspring like the grass of the earth.

26.text: Thou shalt enter into the grave in abundance, as a heap of wheat is brought in its season.

27.text: Behold, this is even so, as we have searched oat: which thou having heard, consider it thoroughly in thy mind.
